headline: Amca acquires Electrocube, a premier Boeing supplier, to expand into power electronics
summary: Amca, an El Segundo-based aerospace and defense company, has acquired Electrocube of Pomona, California from two of its founding families. The transaction adds flight-critical power electronics to Amca's growing capabilities. Shedd Capital served as an advisor on the deal.

raw.headline: Amca acquires Electrocube, a premier Boeing supplier, to expand into power electronics

headline: Boeing's Profit Illusion: The Real Turnaround Starts Now
summary: Boeing is in a turnaround phase, with 2025 marking foundational improvements, but Q4 earnings are driven by divestiture, not core operations. Read more macro analysis here.

headline: BAE Systems, Inc. Appoints Mona Bates Chief Information and Digital Officer
summary: FALLS CHURCH, Va., February 12, 2026--BAE Systems, Inc. has appointed Mona Bates senior vice president and Chief Information and Digital Officer.

headline: Howmet Stock Jumps. Earnings Show Strength For This Sector.
summary: The aerospace company reported fourth-quarter earnings per share of $1.05 from sales of $2.2 billion. Wall Street was looking for EPS of 97 cents from sales of $2.1 billion.

raw.headline: Howmet Stock Jumps. Earnings Show Strength For This Sector.

headline: Howmet Aerospace first-quarter forecast exceeds estimates, shares higher premarket
summary: Investing.com - Howmet Aerospace unveiled a current-quarter financial forecast which exceeded expectations, as the jet engine component maker said it expects to notch improved profit and cash generation this year.

raw.headline: Howmet Aerospace first-quarter forecast exceeds estimates, shares higher premarket
raw.summary: Investing.com - Howmet Aerospace unveiled a current-quarter financial forecast which exceeded expectations, as the jet engine component maker said it expects to notch improved profit and cash generation this year.

headline: Can American Airlines turn itself around?
summary: American Airlines has promised Wall Street and travelers that 2026 will be a turnaround year. It’s been trailing its U.S. competitors Delta Air Lines and United Airlines in profits and reliability by a wide margin and has fallen behind in the race for premium air travel. So the pressure is on for CEO Robert Isom.

raw.headline: Can American Airlines turn itself around?

headline: Boeing Orders And Defense Wins Test Valuation Gap And Labor Risks
summary: In January, Boeing reported one of its strongest recent months for aircraft orders and deliveries, including a substantial widebody order from Delta Air Lines. The company secured significant long term U.S. Air Force contracts tied to C-17A fleet upgrades. Boeing announced plans for a new 737 Max assembly line while unions raised concerns about potential job relocations to South Carolina. Boeing (NYSE:BA) enters this news cycle with its shares at $236.26 and a 1 year return of 26.9%. Over 3...
